intro: Puccinellia kobayashii, commonly known as Japanese glassworts, is a species of flowering plant in the family Plantaginaceae. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist or wet environments such as marshes and coastal areas. The plant has slender, erect stems and small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually clustered in spikes. Its leaves are usually fleshy and succulent, adapted to retain water in its native habitat. Puccinellia kobayashii is often found in temperate regions of Asia, including Japan and parts of China.
